intro: Spermacoce jacobsonii, commonly known as Jacobson's sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and alternate leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Spermacoce jacobsonii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
